action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the side table, the book in the refrigerator and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a bedroom, a kitchen and a hallway here.
You can't see a table here.
You are not in a livingroom.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a bedroom, a kitchen and a hallway here.
You can't see a table here.
The book is not on the chair.
The book is not on the couch.
You are not in a livingroom.
You are already in the living room.
You are not in a livingroom.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
Livingroom is not an entity. (this should not occur.)
I don't know how to interpret this 'search' action.

> check couch
> check chair
> check floor
There is nothing on the couch.
There is nothing on the chair.
You can't see a floor here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
There is a book on the table.
You can't see a book here.
> take book from table in kitchen
You can't see a book here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know how to interpret this 'inspect' action.
> check table in kitchen for book
I don't know how to interpret this 'check' action.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a bedroom, a kitchen and a hallway here.
You can't see a table here.
You are not in a livingroom.
You are already in the living room.
You can't see a table here.
I don't know what 'current position' means.
I don't know what 'invisible table' means.
I don't know what 'unseeable table' means.
> take book from assumed table location
I don't know what you mean.
> take book from where table should be
I don't know what you mean.
> take book from where it was last seen
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what 'memory location' means.
> take book assuming it's still in the living room
